description: One-minute skill: Network Effects: Why Size Is Power.

hook.text: The first fax machine was worthless â€” nobody else had one.

buildup.text: Network effects: a product becomes more valuable as more people use it.

discovery.text: Metcalfe's Law: a network's value grows proportionally to the square of its users.

twist.text: Network effects can work in reverse. Users leave MySpace for Facebook; more users leave because their friends left.

climax.text: Network effects explain why tech markets tip toward monopoly.

punchline.text: In networks, the rich get richer â€” not because they're better.

quiz.question: What makes network effects so powerful in creating monopolies?
options: Each new user makes the product more valuable for all existing users, creating a self-reinforcing advantage that's hard to compete against
